maintext.text:
Commander,
it's me again.

I'm running out of time here.

What should we do?

leftButton.lbText:
Listen,
I've come up with a plan to get you out of there alive.

rightButton.rbText: I couldn't think of anything. We'll have to improvise.

maintext.text:
Dr. Muller,
I'm sure you're already preparing for your ascend to the surface.
The transporter is already waiting for you there.

Uhm, yes. Of course, C.U.R.E.
There's just one little matter that we need to take care of.

rightButton.rbText:
Oh really,
what is it, Robin?

maintext.text:
You know, Commander.

That thing. The one which prevents me from going to the transporter and leaving for the surface.

leftButton.lbText:
Ohh yes, sure.
The thing!

Yes, I'm afraid that's still a problem.

rightButton.rbText:
Hm, sorry.
No idea what you're talking about.

maintext.text:
I'm talking about that big problem, the one we wanted to talk about...

Did you already forget?

leftButton.lbText:
Why didn't you say that in the first place, Robin.

C.U.R.E., we have a problem.

maintext.text:
What is this problem you are talking about?

My sensors are not picking up anything unusual.

leftButton.lbText: The transporter is carrying mercenaries. They've been sent to secure the samples and eliminate Robin.

rightButton.rbText:
[lie]
We've got reason to believe that the transporter's crew is planning to destroy the samples.

maintext.text:
Yes, that's true.

You need to help us out here, C.U.R.E.

We need to stop them somehow.

leftButton.lbText:
C.U.R.E.,

send the transporter back the way it came.

rightButton.rbText: C.U.R.E., notify the transporter that there's a problem. They need to come down here and pick up the samples themselves.

maintext.text: My records do not indicate that the transporter could pose a threat, or that anyone aboard would want to sabotage the mission.

leftButton.lbText: If there's even the slightest chance that what we're saying is true, our mission is endangered. Do some calculations on that.

rightButton.rbText: But there's still a possibility that you won't be able to successfully complete your mission.

maintext.text:
That seems...

plausible, Commander.

Calculating possible scenarios.

Please wait...

Please wait...

Commander,

my calculations are complete.

I have concluded that there is a 7.3 percent chance that you are telling the truth.

leftButton.lbText:
Of course I'm telling the truth.

I never lie!

rightButton.rbText:
7.3 percent.

That should be enough to warrant countermeasures.

maintext.text:
I will contact the shuttle and arrange for the crew to be sent down to the station.

As soon as they arrive here I will take care of the problem.

Goodbye.

leftButton.lbText:
Good idea C.U.R.E.

Let's show them who's the boss!

rightButton.rbText: Okay, but please don't hurt anyone.

maintext.text:
Commander,

do you think that's a good idea?

C.U.R.E. could do some serious damage.

leftButton.lbText:
I don't know.

But I couldn't think of anything better.

rightButton.rbText: He's our last chance to get you out of there alive.

maintext.text:
What am I supposed to do until the death squad shows up?

Just sit around and hope that our supercomputer saves the day?

leftButton.lbText: Hide in your quarters and wait until C.U.R.E. has dealt with the mercenaries.

rightButton.rbText: Hide in the lab. It has multiple exits and escape routes.

maintext.text:
Okay, will do.

See you later.

Over and Out.

Commander,

please be patient.

I will take care of this matter.

You can trust me.
